author: Special Correspondent
text:
A general manager with the Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited was arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation for allegedly demanding a bribe of Rs 2 lakh from a contractor.

According to CBI officials, Subhash Kamble was employed as GM of the Ratnagiri branch of the BSNL and was holding additional charge of the Sindhudurg branch.

The Ratnagiri branch had outsourced the job of installing cables for new connections and other related work to a private contractor in the area. The contractor had recently submitted his bills for the services rendered.

In exchange for getting the bills approved, Kamble was allegedly demanding a three per cent cut in the bill amount, which came up to Rs 2 lakh. The contractor then approached the CBI’s Anti-Corruption Bureau.

“In order to evade detection, Kamble had asked the complainant to pay the bribe amount through a civilian, identified as Tanveer. As a further precaution from authorities, Tanveer asked the complainant to transfer the amount to his friend’s account,” said a CBI official.

Acting on the CBI’s instructions, the complainant transferred the money to the account specified by Tanveer.

As soon as the money was transferred, the CBI arrested Tanveer.
title: CBI arrests BSNL official for graft
